note:
VERIFIED with two minor/note-level issues raised (ch-358f1c1e585f1b59 for missing formal dependency declarations, ch-1d37acc993fe89b6 for SFF normalization convention).

The node is well-structured and mathematically sound given its explicitly conditional nature. Key verification findings:

(1) DEPENDENCY DECLARATION: Properly stated in text. The node explicitly conditions all non-trivial claims on nodes 1.3.1 and 1.3.2. The formal dependency metadata is empty (minor issue raised), but the textual conditioning is unambiguous.

(2) ESTABLISHED FACTS: All four unconditional facts verified:
  - (i) Melonic dominance at q=1 confirmed from Draft.tex eqs. (12jasmtot): 12j cube ~ j*(log j)/j, melonic vacuum ~ j.
  - (ii) Analyticity of Z(q,j,beta) at fixed j follows from Tr(exp(-beta*A(q))) being an analytic function when A(q) is an analytic matrix-valued function (Kato theory).
  - (iii) SUSY preservation correctly attributed to validated node 1.1, with explicit caveat distinguishing algebraic structure from BPS degeneracy.
  - (iv) Witten index q-independence: W_r = omega^{-N/2}(1-omega^r)^N matches paper eq. (WI1). q-independence follows from SUSY index theorem for finite-dimensional Hilbert spaces (R = N_psi/3 is q-independent; supertrace kills non-BPS contributions).

(3) CONDITIONAL ANALYSIS: Properly structured as IF-THEN. The explicit statement "This is a loss of the SD-equation solvability mechanism, not the discovery of a new saddle point" correctly addresses the earlier challenge about new saddle points. The explicit rejection of "phase transition" terminology with a precise explanation of why (no free energy defined, existence of limit unproven, interchange-of-limits issue) is mathematically careful.

(4) BPS SECTOR: Properly flagged as open, correctly referencing node 1.3.5. Upper semicontinuity argument is correctly stated.

(5) NON-BPS SPECTRUM: Properly labeled as conjectural. The explicit statement "These are statements about what CANNOT be computed, not about what the spectrum IS" is an important epistemic qualification.

The node has addressed all 5 previous critical/major challenges satisfactorily. The remaining issues are minor (formal dependencies) and notational (SFF convention). ACCEPT.
